Look up Baseball Player IDs

Source: R/playerid_lookup.R
playerid_lookup.Rd

This function allows you to query the Chadwick Bureau's public register of baseball players and the various IDs associated with them in different systems of record.

playerid_lookup(last_name = NULL, first_name = NULL)

Arguments

last_name

A text string used to return results for players with that string in their last name.
first_name

A text string used to return results for players with that string in their first name.

Examples

# \donttest{
playerid_lookup("Garcia", "Karim")
#> Be patient, this may take a few seconds...
#> Data courtesy of the Chadwick Bureau Register (https://github.com/chadwickbureau/register)
#> Rows: 409913 Columns: 40
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (10): key_person, key_uuid, key_retro, key_bbref, key_bbref_minors, name...
#> dbl (16): key_mlbam, key_fangraphs, birth_year, birth_month, birth_day, deat...
#> lgl (14): key_npb, key_sr_nfl, key_sr_nba, key_sr_nhl, key_findagrave, name_...
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> [1] "Be patient, this may take a few seconds..."
#> [1] "Data courtesy of the Chadwick Bureau Register (https://github.com/chadwickbureau/register)"

#>   first_name last_name given_name    name_suffix nick_name birth_year
#>   <chr>      <chr>     <chr>         <chr>       <chr>          <dbl>

#> # … with 5 more variables: mlb_played_first <dbl>, mlbam_id <dbl>,
